page.title: 07BOXWORTH - RELIGION
page.content: Boxworth Church, dedicated to St.Peter was built in the fourteenth century. It is constructed mainly of flint and stone in the Decorated style.The main communicants are people over sixty years old, no children attend Church. Marriage and baptism services are rare. As with many other parishes, Boxworth is a shared parish, the vicar also has Elsworth, Knapwell and Conington to look after. The vicar,the Reverend Hugh Mosedale, lives in Boxworth in the vicarage, a very large building with extensive gardens full of wild flowers. Roman Catholic communicants attend Churches in Papworth and Cambridge.
